org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit

Class MissingPermissionsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.unitTests.junit.MissingPermissionsTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class MissingPermissionsTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Test behavior when permissions are missing for:
    • reading of system properties, see DERBY-6617
    • read, write access to create derby.system.home, see DERBY-6617
    Note: requires English locale because the test asserts on localized strings.

      • testPresentPropertiesPermission

        public void testPresentPropertiesPermission()
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                            java.io.IOException,
                                            java.security.PrivilegedActionException
        This test is run with a policy that does not lack permission to read properties for derby.jar. This should leave no related error messages on derby.log.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.PrivilegedActionException

      • testMissingPropertiesPermission

        public void testMissingPropertiesPermission()
                                     throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                            java.io.IOException,
                                            java.security.PrivilegedActionException
        This test is run with a policy that lacks permission to read properties for derby.jar. This should lead to error messages on derby.log.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.PrivilegedActionException

      • testMissingFilePermission

        public void testMissingFilePermission()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                      java.io.IOException,
                                      java.security.PrivilegedActionException,
                                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        This test is run with a policy that lacks permission for derby.jar to create a db directory for derby. In this scenario we expect the boot to fail, and an error message to be printed to the console, so we try to get it by forking a sub-process. See FileMonitor#PBinitialize when it gets a SecurityException following attempt to do "home.mkdir(s)".

        Note that the policy used with this text fixture also doubles as the one used by the subprocess to demonstrate the lack of permission.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        java.security.PrivilegedActionException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • makeMessage

        private java.lang.String makeMessage(java.lang.String property)
        Make a regex that matches a warning for missing property permission.
        Parameters:
        property - the property for which read permission is missing
        Returns:
        a pattern that matches the expected warning
